Message: The user completes the submission of the form
I did an ad set "Moissanite" and it has said active and that it was learning but nothing is happening.  I have had zero clicks etc

Hi Kristin, I see that your ad set 'Moissanite' is active and in the learning phase but hasn't received any clicks yet. Let's try to troubleshoot this issue. Could you please provide more details about your targeting settings and budget? This will help me understand the situation better and provide more specific advice.
I started with $10 per day to see if there is interest.

Thanks for the details, Kristin. Starting with a $10 daily budget is a good approach to test interest. Since your ad set is in the learning phase and hasn't received any clicks, it might need some adjustments to improve performance. Here are a few suggestions based on best practices:
1. **Increase Budget Gradually**: Consider increasing your daily budget by 50% every 2-3 days to help the system gather more data and find the right audience.
2. **Review Targeting Options**: Ensure your targeting options are well-defined and relevant to your audience. Avoid making drastic changes frequently as it can disrupt the learning process.
3. **Optimize Creative Assets**: Test different creative assets (images, videos) and separate them into different ad sets if possible.
4. **Be Patient During Cold Start Period**: The Cold Start Period typically lasts 2-5 days, during which the system gathers crucial learnings about user behavior.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our article on tCPA Best Practices [here](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
Let me know if you need further assistance!
but there is zero information to base an increase on

I understand your concern, Kristin. Since your ad set hasn't gathered enough data yet, it can be challenging to make decisions. Here are a few steps you can take to help the system gather initial data:
1. **Increase Budget Slightly**: Even a small increase in budget can help the system gather more data. Consider increasing your daily budget from $10 to $15 and monitor the performance for a few days.
2. **Check Ad Creative and Copy**: Ensure that your ad creative and copy are engaging and relevant to your target audience. Sometimes tweaking the visuals or messaging can make a big difference.
3. **Expand Targeting Options**: If your targeting is too narrow, try broadening it slightly to reach a larger audience.
4. **Monitor Performance Regularly**: Keep an eye on the performance metrics daily but avoid making frequent changes as it can disrupt the learning phase.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our article on maximizing conversions [here](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
Let me know if you need further assistance!
it isn't even showing money spent there is not activity

Got it, Kristin. If your ad set isn't showing any money spent or activity, there might be an issue with the setup. Here are a few things to check:
1. **Launch Date and Time**: Ensure that the launch date and time are set correctly. Sometimes campaigns are set to start at a later time due to time zone differences.
2. **Ad Approval**: Verify that your ad has been approved and is not under review or disapproved for any reason.
3. **Targeting Settings**: Double-check your targeting settings to ensure they are not too restrictive, which could limit the audience reach.
4. **Ad Creative**: Make sure your ad creative meets all guidelines and is properly uploaded.
If everything seems correct and there's still no activity, you might want to try pausing and then reactivating the ad set to reset it.
For more detailed troubleshooting steps, you can refer to our FAQ [here](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
Let me know if you need further assistance!
representative
I'm here to help with whatever you need! Let me know your question, and I'll do my best to assist you right away.
your answers are not helpful

I'm sorry to hear that my answers haven't been helpful, Kristin. Let me escalate this issue for you. I'll send an email to our support team to get you the assistance you need. Please hold on for a moment.
I've sent an email to our support team to get you the assistance you need, Kristin. They will reach out to you shortly at info@poshyprintista.com. Thank you for your patience!
I have 2 ads I made active but they don't seem to be doing anything.

I'm sorry to hear that your ads aren't performing as expected. Let's try to figure out what's going on. Could you please provide more details about the ads? For example, what kind of targeting are you using, and what is the content of the ads? Also, have you checked the reports for any insights on their performance?
One is a t-shirt and one is a mug - focus on Mother's Day

Thanks for the details! Since your ads are focused on Mother's Day, it's important to ensure that your targeting is aligned with the audience most likely to be interested in these products. Here are a few steps you can take to improve performance:
1. **Targeting**: Make sure you are targeting demographics that are likely to purchase Mother's Day gifts, such as adults aged 25-54.
2. **Ad Creative**: Ensure your ad creative is appealing and highlights the unique aspects of your t-shirts and mugs. High-quality images and compelling copy can make a big difference.
3. **Bidding Strategy**: Review your bidding strategy to ensure it's competitive enough to win ad placements.
4. **A/B Testing**: Try different variations of your ads to see which ones perform better.
5. **Reports**: Check the reports for insights on what's working and what's not. Adjust your strategy based on these insights.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our [Reporting Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18088532505485-Reporting-Guide). This article provides tips on how to analyze underperforming campaigns and make necessary adjustments.
They are not showing activity - no money spent on newsbreak side

It sounds like your ads might not be running correctly. Here are a few things to check:
1. **Ad Status**: Ensure that your ads are active and not paused.
2. **Budget**: Verify that you have set a sufficient daily budget (minimum $10) and that it hasn't been exhausted.
3. **Targeting**: Double-check your targeting settings to ensure they are not too restrictive.
4. **Ad Approval**: Make sure your ads have been approved and are compliant with Newsbreak's ad policies.
5. **Tracking Setup**: Confirm that your tracking is set up correctly so that conversions and clicks are being recorded properly.
For more detailed steps on creating and managing ads, you can refer to our [How to Create Your First Ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17618196971149-How-to-create-your-first-ad) guide.
they both show active
with a green light

Got it. Since your ads are active but not spending, let's try a few more troubleshooting steps:
1. **Launch Date and Time**: Check the launch date and time settings at the ad set level. Ensure that the start date and time are correct and that they are set to run immediately if intended.
2. **Ad Set Learning Phase**: If your ad set is in the learning phase, it might take some time to start spending. Avoid making too many changes during this phase as it can cause fluctuations in performance.
3. **Bid Strategy**: Ensure your bid strategy is competitive enough to win ad placements. You might need to increase your bids slightly.
4. **Audience Size**: Make sure your audience size isn't too small or too broad. Adjust targeting parameters if necessary.
5. **Ad Creative Quality**: High-quality, engaging ad creatives can help improve performance.
For more detailed guidance on optimizing your ads, you can refer to our [Ad Creative Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing) guide.

Thanks for confirming that your ads are active. Since they are showing as active but not spending any budget, let's try a few more troubleshooting steps:
1. **Launch Date and Time**: Ensure that the launch date and time are set correctly. Sometimes, campaigns might be scheduled to start at a later time due to time zone settings.
2. **Ad Set Level**: Check the ad set level to ensure there are no restrictions or errors that might be preventing the ads from running.
3. **Audience Size**: Make sure your audience size is not too small, as this can limit the reach of your ads.
4. **Creative Review**: Double-check that your ad creatives meet all guidelines and have been approved without any issues.
5. **Performance Monitoring**: Regularly monitor the performance in the reporting tab to identify any potential issues early on.
For more detailed guidance on these steps, you can refer to our [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing) guide.

so they are ads they a reactivated - and the dates are off - If the begin date was 2 months ago and I change the end date to , lets say 5 days from now.  It won't charge me all the days in between, correct?

No, you won't be charged for the days in between if your ads were not running during that time. You will only be charged for the days your ads are active and running. If you change the end date to 5 days from now, you will only incur charges for those 5 days as long as your ads are active and spending budget during that period.
perfect we found the problem I think.
Great to hear that you might have found the problem! If you need any further assistance or have any more questions, feel free to ask. I'm here to help!
